issue.title: [NOT READY FOR MERGE] Fix the issue where cmake/ctest finds 0 test despite test binaries having been properly built
issue.body:
## Description
The following command shows that cmake/ctest finds 0 test (although all the test binaries have been properly built and can be individually run in the `/home/coder/cudf/cpp/build/latest/gtests` directory).
```
ctest --test-dir /home/coder/cudf/cpp/build/latest -V -N
```
The reason is that the subproject KvikIO sets the cmake cache variable `BUILD_TESTING` to `OFF` and propagates it to cuDF project. This PR provides a fix.


## Checklist
- [x] I am familiar with the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [x] New or existing tests cover these changes.
- [x] The documentation is up to date with these changes.

issue.title: Disabling curl tests doesn't now disable kvikio cpp tests
issue.body: Works around https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15351 . We cache the `BUILD_TESTING` cache variable when it exists so that our tests are enabled when building curl from source.

body:
Thanks for your report.

Do you know of any documentation or wiki page listing (non-`CMAKE_*`) variable names with "special" behavior like this one?

I guess curl can go by only reading this variable. Would this patch fix this for you?:
```diff
--- a/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -1855,10 +1855,6 @@ set(_generated_dir "${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/generated")
 set(_project_config "${_generated_dir}/${PROJECT_NAME}Config.cmake")
 set(_version_config "${_generated_dir}/${PROJECT_NAME}ConfigVersion.cmake")
 
-cmake_dependent_option(BUILD_TESTING "Build tests"
-  ON "PERL_FOUND;NOT CURL_DISABLE_TESTS"
-  OFF)
-
 if(HAVE_MANUAL_TOOLS)
   set(CURL_MANPAGE "${CURL_BINARY_DIR}/docs/cmdline-opts/curl.1")
   set(CURL_ASCIIPAGE "${CURL_BINARY_DIR}/docs/cmdline-opts/curl.txt")
@@ -1876,7 +1872,7 @@ if(BUILD_EXAMPLES)
   add_subdirectory(docs/examples)
 endif()
 
-if(BUILD_TESTING)
+if(BUILD_TESTING AND PERL_FOUND AND NOT CURL_DISABLE_TESTS)
   add_subdirectory(tests)
 endif()
 
diff --git a/lib/CMakeLists.txt b/lib/CMakeLists.txt
index a1539e22a3..0579b9ea2e 100644
--- a/lib/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/lib/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -46,7 +46,7 @@ if(USE_ARES)
   include_directories(SYSTEM ${CARES_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 endif()
 
-if(BUILD_TESTING)
+if(BUILD_TESTING AND PERL_FOUND AND NOT CURL_DISABLE_TESTS)
   add_library(
     curlu  # special libcurlu library just for unittests
     STATIC
```

@robertmaynard Or would this be better, by keeping an `option()` instead of `cmake_dependent_option()` and the patch above?:
```diff
--- a/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -1855,9 +1855,7 @@ set(_generated_dir "${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/generated")
 set(_project_config "${_generated_dir}/${PROJECT_NAME}Config.cmake")
 set(_version_config "${_generated_dir}/${PROJECT_NAME}ConfigVersion.cmake")
 
-cmake_dependent_option(BUILD_TESTING "Build tests"
-  ON "PERL_FOUND;NOT CURL_DISABLE_TESTS"
-  OFF)
+option(BUILD_TESTING "Build tests" ON)
 
 if(HAVE_MANUAL_TOOLS)
   set(CURL_MANPAGE "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/docs/cmdline-opts/curl.1")
@@ -1876,7 +1874,7 @@ if(BUILD_EXAMPLES)
   add_subdirectory(docs/examples)
 endif()
 
-if(BUILD_TESTING)
+if(BUILD_TESTING AND PERL_FOUND AND NOT CURL_DISABLE_TESTS)
   add_subdirectory(tests)
 endif()
 
diff --git a/lib/CMakeLists.txt b/lib/CMakeLists.txt
index 3e8f196682..c43932d03d 100644
--- a/lib/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/lib/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -46,7 +46,7 @@ if(USE_ARES)
   include_directories(SYSTEM ${CARES_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 endif()
 
-if(BUILD_TESTING)
+if(BUILD_TESTING AND PERL_FOUND AND NOT CURL_DISABLE_TESTS)
   add_library(
     curlu  # special libcurlu library just for unittests
     STATIC
```

curl dependencies `libnghttp2`, `libnghttp3`, `libngtcp2` and `libssh2` all use `option()` on this variable, which makes me think this might be OK.

---

Links:
https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/enable_testing.html
https://cmake.org/cmake/help/book/mastering-cmake/chapter/Testing%20With%20CMake%20and%20CTest.html

issue.body:
`BUILD_TESTING` variable is used by other projects and CMake internally.
Replace `cmake_dependent_option()` with `option()` and introduce an
internal variable to track if want and can do testing.

Reported-by: Robert Maynard
Fixes #15351
Follow-up to #6036
Follow-up to 3a1e798009799be1e9fad30666351b66f250befb #6072

body:
CMake documents variables at https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/manual/cmake-variables.7.html but we missed adding `BUILD_TESTING` which I have fixed ( https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/merge_requests/9927 ).

Using `option` instead of `cmake_dependent_option` would be an excellent solution since `option` doesn't force overwrite any existing cache value, or create a cache variable when a local variable with that name exists ( behavior added in CMake 3.13 https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/policy/CMP0077.html ).
Nice, thanks! I've opened #15355 with a proposed fix, would you mind taking a look/try and tell us if it fixes the problem?
